text.title: part1_Wikinews interviews Australian Glider Amanda Carter

p.s: That would have been about right .
It was pretty packed .
That must have been awesome .
It was .
It was .
I guess also because it was the USA .
It was their home crowd and everything , so it was a very packed game .
They also have a fondness for the sport .
They do .
They love basketball .
But Atlanta again was done very well .

Would have been nice to get the medal , ‘ cause I think we sort of had bigger expectations of ourselves at that point , ‘ cause we were n't the new kids on the block at that point but still finished fourth .
They kept on saying in London that the Gliders have never won .
We 've never won a gold , no .
Not at World 's or Paralympics .
So that was Atlanta .
Then there was another tournament , the 1998 Gold Cup .
Yes .
Which was the World Championships held in Sydney .
How did we go in that ?
Third .
But that qualified ... no , wait , we did n't need to qualify ...
We did n't need to qualify .
You were the second leading scorer in the event , with thirty points scored for the competition .
Yes .
Which was unusual for a low pointer .
In basketball , some of the low pointers do pretty well .
Yeah , but in those days I guess it was more unusual for a low pointer to be more a scorer .
I notice the scores seem lower than the ones in London .
Yes .
I think over time the women 's game has developed .
Girls have got stronger and they 're competing against guys .
Training has got better , and all sorts of things .
So teams have just got better .
How often do the Gliders get together ?
It seems that you are all scattered all over the country normally .
Yes .

I mean we 've got currently three in
Perth
, four in Melbourne , four in
New South Wales
, and one in
Brisbane
out of the twelve that were in London .
But the squad is bigger again .
We usually get together probably every six or eight weeks .
That 's reasonably often .
Cost-wise it 's expensive to get us all together .
What we sometimes do is tack a camp on to the Women 's League , when we 're mostly all together anyway , no matter where it is , and we might stay a couple of extra days in order to train together .
But generally if we come into camp it would be at the AIS .
I did n't see you training in Sydney this time ... then you went over to ...
